Whereas what they should be doing for the mac is testing is Flash available. If it is, give them Flash, if it’s not give them the same HTML5 video that we’re giving to the iPad.

John Gruber in episode 16 of The Talk Show on getting HTML5 video instead of Flash by spoofing your browser’s user agent string.

I disagree with Gruber here. Web developers shouldn’t be testing for the presence of Flash, they should be testing for the presence of HTML5 video support. If the browser supports <video>, serve them <video> whether they have Flash installed or not. It’s a better experience.
